intro: Spermacoce balansae, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Spermacoce balansae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
